text: The Annobon leaf-toed gecko (Hemidactylus aporus) is a species of geckos in the family Gekkonidae. It is only known from the island of Annobón, Equatorial Guinea. The species was described and named by George Albert Boulenger in 1906 based on several specimens collected by Leonardo Fea between sea level and 500 metres elevation. ==References== ==External links== * aporus Category:Endemic fauna of Annobón Category:Reptiles of Equatorial Guinea Category:Reptiles described in 1906 Category:Taxa named by George Albert Boulenger
title: Annobon leaf-toed gecko
